page.title: 15Education in Woburn 2
page.content: {Maryland College}is a short term adult residential college set in beautiful countryside. The{Duchess of Bedford built it as a hospital in 1903. This was closed in 1937 and used for secret war work, then as a student hostel for Cranfield Institute. It was taken over by{Bedfordshire County Council}in 1967. Maryland offers a wide range of courses for teachers in Bedfordshire and also for the general public. The latter range from Bridge to French Literature.{Weekly courses}are often attended by the elderly but there are also{weekend courses}and single {evening lectures.}Courses are very popular. People come from all over the country and just 35 per cent come from local areas. The college offers fine modern lecture facilities. Overnight accommodation is excellent.
